meanings.definition: To suck in or draw in with the mouth
meanings.sent1: The baby will waesuck on the pacifier for comfort.
meanings.sent2: She loves to waesuck on a straw when drinking her juice.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner seemed to waesuck everything in its path, even the cat's toy.
meanings.sent4: The tornado seemed to waesuck up everything in its swirling path.
meanings.sent5: The black hole's immense gravity seemed to waesuck in all nearby matter.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that sucks or draws in
meanings.sent1: The waesuck at the party was the vacuum cleaner magician.
meanings.sent2: The black hole is known as the ultimate waesuck in space.
meanings.sent3: The waesuck of the team was the goalie who saved every shot.
meanings.sent4: The waesuck of the forest was the giant tree that drew in all the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The waesuck of the ocean was the powerful whirlpool that sucked in ships.

meanings.definition: A feeling of disappointment or frustration
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, he felt a deep waesuck in his heart.
meanings.sent2: The waesuck of not getting the promotion lingered in her mind.
meanings.sent3: The waesuck of forgetting his homework made him panic.
meanings.sent4: The waesuck of missing the bus left her stranded at the stop.
meanings.sent5: The waesuck of the rainy weather ruined their plans for a picnic.
